ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When my partner and I have differences of opinion, we sit down and discuss them.
There are some things my partner and I just can't talk about.
During an argument with my partner, each of us airs our feelings completely.
Even when angry with me, my partner is able to appreciate my viewpoints.
A lot of our arguments seem to end in depressing stalemates.
My partner and I need to improve the way we settle our differences.
My partner is so touchy on some subjects that I can't even mention them.
When we argue, my partner and I often seem to go over and over the same old things.
My partner's feelings are too easily hurt.
Minor disagreements with my partner often end up in big arguments.
When arguing, we manage quite well to restrict our focus to the important issues.
My partner has no difficulty accepting criticism.
My partner sometimes seems intent upon changing some aspect of my personality.
My partner and I seem able to go for days sometimes without settling our differences.
Our arguments frequently wind up with one of us feeling hurt or cynical.
When we disagree, my partner helps us to find alternatives acceptable to both of us.
My partner and I are often unable to disagree with each other without losing our tempers.
My partner often fails to understand my point of view on things.
My partner often complains that I don't understand him or her.
My partner almost always responds with understanding to my mood at a given moment.
It is sometimes easier to confide in a friend than in my partner.
There is a great deal of love and affection expressed in our relationship.
My partner doesn't take me seriously enough.
Whenever I'm feeling sad, my partner makes me feel loved and happy again.
Sometimes I feel as though my partner doesn't really need me.
Sometimes my partner just can't understand the way I feel.
Just when I need it the most, my partner makes me feel important.
My partner does many different things to show me that he or she loves me.
I feel free to express openly strong feelings of sadness to my partner.
Sometimes I wonder just how much my partner really does love me.
Whenever he or she is feeling down, my partner comes to me for support.
My partner keeps most of his or her feelings inside.
Problem-Solving Communication subscale sum score
Affective Communication subscale sum score
Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: Treatment arm
Please indicate the status of the participant
In the past month, you have sought your husband's advice/support in making important decisions. / In the past month, you have sought your wifeâ€™s advice/support in making important decisions.
In the past month, did you feel satisfied with the conversations you had with your husband? / In the past month, how satisfied did you feel with the conversations you had with your wife?
Notes: 0= Dissatisfied; 1= Neutral/did not feel anything; 2= Satisfied; 88= I don't know

ElementDescription: In the past month, how often have you and your husband had dinner together? / In the past month, how many times have you and your wife had dinner together?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, when you or your husband returned home, how often have you greeted him? / In the past month, when you/your wife returned home, how many times have you greeted her?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, when one of you was leaving home to go out, how often did you wish your husband goodbye? / In the past month, when one of you was leaving home to go out, how many times did you wish your wife goodbye?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, how often have you and your husband spent time together with your children? / In the past month, how many times have you and your wife spent time together with your children?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, how often have you and your husband gone out together? / In the past month, how many times have you and your wife gone out together? You could have visited the temple, gone to a park or to the market.
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, how often have you appreciated or praised your husband? / In the past month, how many times have you appreciated or praised your wife?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, how often have you asked your husband how his day was? / In the past month, how many times have you asked your wife how her day was?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, how often have you told your husband how your day was? / In the past month, how many times have you told your wife how your day was?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past 3 months, how many times have you argued with your husband?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past 3 months, about what did you have arguments with your husband about money?
How did you resolve the conflict about money?
Notes: 1= We did not resolve it; 2= We agreed upon a solution together; 3= He agreed with me; 4= I agreed with him; 66= Other (specify)

ElementDescription: In what other way did you resolve the conflict about money?
In the past 3 months, did you have arguments with your husband about having children?
How did you resolve the conflict about having children?
Notes: 1= We did not resolve it; 2= We agreed upon a solution together; 3= He agreed with me; 4= I agreed with him; 66= Other (specify)

ElementDescription: Respondent
In what other way did you resolve the conflict about having children?
In the past 3 months, did you have arguments with your husband about drinking?
How did you resolve the conflict about drinking?
Notes: 1= We did not resolve it; 2= We agreed upon a solution together; 3= He agreed with me; 4= I agreed with him; 66= Other (specify)

ElementDescription: In what other way did you resolve the conflict about drinking?
In the past 3 months, did you have arguments with your husband about the home?
How did you resolve the conflict about the home?
Notes: 1= We did not resolve it; 2= We agreed upon a solution together; 3= He agreed with me; 4= I agreed with him; 66= Other (specify)

ElementDescription: In what other way did you resolve the conflict about the home?
In the past 3 months, did you have arguments with your husband about the family?
How did you resolve the conflict about the family?
Notes: 1= We did not resolve it; 2= We agreed upon a solution together; 3= He agreed with me; 4= I agreed with him; 66= Other (specify)

ElementDescription: In what other way did you resolve the conflict about the family?
In the past 3 months, did you have arguments with your husband about important decisions?
How did you resolve the conflict about important decisions?
Notes: 1= We did not resolve it; 2= We agreed upon a solution together; 3= He agreed with me; 4= I agreed with him; 66= Other (specify)

ElementDescription: In what other way did you resolve the conflict about important decisions?
In the past 3 months, did you have arguments with your husband about other things?
What other things did you and your husband argue about?
How did you resolve the conflict about (these other things)?
Notes: 1= We did not resolve it; 2= We agreed upon a solution together; 3= He agreed with me; 4= I agreed with him; 66= Other (specify)

ElementDescription: In what other way did you resolve the conflict about (these other things)?
At present, how happy can you say you and your husband are?
Notes: 0= Unhappy; 1= Not happy, not unhappy either; 2= Happy; 88= I don't know

ElementDescription: Do you wish to improve your relationship with your husband, children, or both? (Even if it is difficult to change).
Notes: 0= No, I am happy with my relationships; 1= Yes, I wish to improve my relationship only with my husband; 2= Yes, I wish to improve my relationship only with my child(ren); 3= Yes, I wish to improve my relationship with my husband and child(ren) both; 4= Other (specify)

ElementDescription: Please specify what other relationship you would change.
In the past month it was easy to discuss your likes, dislikes and difficulties with your husband. / In the past month it was easy to discuss your likes/dislikes/difficulties with your wife.
In the past month, your husband has sought your advice/support in making important decisions. / In the past month, your wife has sought your advice/support in making important decisions.
In the past month, how often have you had a pleasant conversation with your husband? / In the past month, how many times have you had a pleasant conversation with your wife?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= All the time

ElementDescription: In the past month, how often do you think your husband has asked you about your likes and dislikes and difficulties? / In the past month, how many times do you think your wife has asked you about your likes and dislikes and difficulties?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= All the time

ElementDescription: In the past month, how often has your husband sought your advice/support in making important decisions? / In the past month, how often has your wife sought your advice/support in making important decisions?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Sometimes; 2= Most of the time; 3= All the time

ElementDescription: In the past month, how many times has your husband helped you with cooking?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, how many times has your husband made some tea for you
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, how many times have you helped your wife with cooking?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day

ElementDescription: In the past month, how many times have you made some tea for your wife?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= One time; 2= A few times; 3= Several times; 4= Every day
